description: This trap indicates that the physical
layer of the network is now up.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ADTRAN-TSUIQ-MIB::adTSUIQNetworkPhysUp RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 ADTRAN-MIB::adProdPhysAddress s EXAMPLE

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This octet string variable contains the Adtran
Physical Address assigned to this product. For
example, the octet sequence 16 02 03 01 specifies
bank/shelf number 22 (hex 16), group number 2
slot number 3, unit/port 1. This object value is
commonly reported in SNMP Traps to identify the
product's location.
variables.name: ADTRAN-MIB::adProdPhysAddress

description: This trap indicates that the physical
layer of the network is now down.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ADTRAN-TSUIQ-MIB::adTSUIQNetworkPhysDown RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 ADTRAN-MIB::adProdPhysAddress s EXAMPLE

variables.name: ADTRAN-MIB::adProdPhysAddress

description: This trap indicates that a cold start has occurred.
